Event.name: Broker:Conversation
Event.description: Reports the progress of a Service Broker conversation.

Event.name: Broker:Conversation Group
Event.description: Occurs when Service Broker creates a new conversation group or drops an existing conversation group.

Event.name: Broker:Connection
Event.description: Reports the status of a transport connection managed by Service Broker.

Event.name: Broker:Forwarded Message Sent
Event.description: Occurs when Service Broker forwards a message.

Event.name: Broker:Forwarded Message Dropped
Event.description: Occurs when Service Broker drops a message that was intended to be forwarded.

Event.name: Broker:Message Classify
Event.description: Occurs when Service Broker determines the routing for a message.

Event.name: Broker:Transmission
Event.description: Indicates that errors have occurred in the Service Broker transport layer. The error number and state values indicate the source of the error.

Event.name: Broker:Queue Disabled
Event.description: Indicates a poison message was detected because there were five consecutive transaction rollbacks on a Service Broker queue. The event contains the database ID and queue ID of the queue that contains the poison message.

Event.name: Broker:Message Undeliverable
Event.description: Occurs when Service Broker is unable to retain a received message that should have been delivered to a service.

Event.name: Broker:Corrupted Message
Event.description: Occurs when Service Broker receives a corrupted message.

Event.name: Broker:Activation
Event.description: Occurs when a queue monitor starts an activation stored procedure, sends a QUEUE_ACTIVATION notification, or when an activation stored procedure started by a queue monitor exits.

Event.name: Broker:Remote Message Acknowledgement
Event.description: Occurs when Service Broker sends or receives a message acknowledgement.

Event.name: Assembly Load
Event.description: Occurs when a request to load a CLR assembly occurs.

Event.name: CursorOpen
Event.description: Indicates when a cursor is opened on a Transact-SQL statement by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library.

Event.name: CursorExecute
Event.description: A cursor previously prepared on a Transact-SQL statement by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library is executed.

Event.name: CursorRecompile
Event.description: A cursor opened on a Transact-SQL statement by ODBC or DB-Library has been recompiled either directly or due to a schema change. Triggered for ANSI and non-ANSI cursors.

Event.name: CursorImplicitConversion
Event.description: A cursor on a Transact-SQL statement is converted by SQL Server from one type to another. Triggered for ANSI and non-ANSI cursors.

Event.name: CursorUnprepare
Event.description: A prepared cursor on a Transact-SQL statement is unprepared (deleted) by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library.

Event.name: CursorClose
Event.description: A cursor previously opened on a Transact-SQL statement by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library is closed.

Event.name: CursorPrepare
Event.description: Indicates when a cursor on a Transact-SQL statement is prepared for use by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library.

Event.name: Data File Auto Grow
Event.description: Indicates that a data file was extended automatically by the server.

Event.name: Data File Auto Shrink
Event.description: Indicates that a data file was shrunk automatically by the server.

Event.name: Database Mirroring State Change
Event.description: Occurs when the state of a mirrored database changes.

Event.name: Log File Auto Grow
Event.description: Indicates that a data file was extended automatically by the server.

Event.name: Log File Auto Shrink
Event.description: Indicates that a log file was shrunk automatically by the server.

Event.name: Deprecation Announcement
Event.description: Occurs when you use a feature that will be removed from a future version of SQL Server.

Event.name: Deprecation Final Support
Event.description: Occurs when you use a feature that will be removed from the next major release of SQL Server.

Event.name: Attention
Event.description: Occurs when attention events, such as client-interrupt requests or broken client connections, happen.

Event.name: Background Job Error
Event.description: Occurs when a background job terminates abnormally.

Event.name: Blocked Process Report
Event.description: Occurs when a process has been blocked for more than a specified amount of time. Does not include system processes or processes that are waiting on non deadlock-detectable resources. Use sp_configure to configure the threshold and frequency at which reports are generated.

Event.name: ErrorLog
Event.description: Indicates that error events have been logged in the SQL Server error log.

Event.name: EventLog
Event.description: Indicates that events have been logged in the Microsoft Windows application log.

Event.name: Exception
Event.description: Indicates that an exception has occurred in SQL Server.

Event.name: Exchange Spill Event
Event.description: Occurs when communication buffers in a parallel query plan have been temporarily written to the tempdb database.

Event.name: Execution Warnings
Event.description: Indicates any warnings that occurred during the execution of a SQL Server statement or stored procedure.

Event.name: Hash Warning
Event.description: Indicates that a hashing operation (for example, hash join, hash aggregate, hash union, and hash distinct) that is not processing on a buffer partition has reverted to an alternate plan. This can occur because of recursion depth, data skew, trace flags, or bit counting.

Event.name: Missing Column Statistics
Event.description: Column statistics that could have been useful for the optimizer are not available.

Event.name: Missing Join Predicate
Event.description: Query that has no join predicate is being executed. This could result in a long-running query.

Event.name: Sort Warnings
Event.description: Indicates sort operations that do not fit into memory. Does not include sort operations involving the creating of indexes; only sort operations within a query (such as an ORDER BY clause used in a SELECT statement).

Event.name: User Error Message
Event.description: Displays error messages that users see in the case of an error or exception.

Event.name: Deadlock Graph
Event.description: Occurs when an attempt to acquire a lock is canceled because the attempt was part of a deadlock and was chosen as the deadlock victim. Provides an XML description of a deadlock.

Event.name: Lock:Acquired
Event.description: Indicates acquisition of a lock on a resource, such as a data page.

Event.name: Lock:Released
Event.description: Indicates that a lock on a resource, such as a page, has been released.

Event.name: Lock:Cancel
Event.description: Indicates that the acquisition of a lock on a resource has been canceled (for example, due to a deadlock).

Event.name: Lock:Deadlock
Event.description: Indicates that two concurrent transactions have deadlocked each other by trying to obtain incompatible locks on resources the other transaction owns.

Event.name: Lock:Deadlock Chain
Event.description: Produced for each of the events leading up to the deadlock.

Event.name: Lock:Escalation
Event.description: Indicates that a finer-grained lock has been converted to a coarser-grained lock (for example, a page lock escalated or converted to a table lock).

Event.name: Lock:Timeout
Event.description: Indicates that a request for a lock on a resource, such as a page, has timed out due to another transaction holding a blocking lock on the required resource. Time-out is determined by the @@LOCK_TIMEOUT function, and can be set with the SET LOCK_TIMEOUT statement.

Event.name: Lock:Timeout (timeout > 0)
Event.description: Occurs when a request for a lock on a resource, such as a page, times out.

Event.name: OLEDB Call Event
Event.description: Occurs when OLE DB provider calls are made for distributed queries and remote stored procedures.

Event.name: OLEDB DataRead Event
Event.description: Occurs when a data request call is made to the OLE DB provider.

Event.name: OLEDB Errors
Event.description: Indicates that an OLE DB error has occurred.

Event.name: OLEDB Provider Information
Event.description: Occurs when a distributed query runs and collects information corresponding to the provider connection.

Event.name: OLEDB QueryInterface Event
Event.description: Occurs when OLE DB QueryInterface calls are made for distributed queries and remote stored procedures.

Event.name: Object:Created
Event.description: Indicates that an object has been created, such as for CREATE INDEX, CREATE TABLE, and CREATE DATABASE statements.

Event.name: Object:Deleted
Event.description: Indicates that an object has been deleted, such as in DROP INDEX and DROP TABLE statements.

Event.name: Object:Altered
Event.description: Occurs when a database object is altered.

Event.name: FT:Crawl Started
Event.description: Occurs when a full-text crawl (population) starts. Use to check if a crawl request is picked up by worker tasks.

Event.name: FT:Crawl Stopped
Event.description: Occurs when a full-text crawl (population) stops. Stops occur when a crawl completes successfully or when a fatal error occurs.

Event.name: FT:Crawl Aborted
Event.description: Occurs when an exception is encountered during a full-text crawl. Usually causes the full-text crawl to stop.

Event.name: Auto Stats
Event.description: Indicates an automatic updating of index statistics has occurred.

Event.name: Degree of Parallelism Event (7.0 Insert)
Event.description: Occurs before a SELECT, INSERT, or UPDATE statement is executed.

Event.name: Performance statistics
Event.description: Occurs when a compiled query plan has been cached for the first time, recompiled, or removed from the plan cache.

Event.name: SQL:FullTextQuery
Event.description: Occurs when a full text query executes.

Event.name: Showplan All
Event.description: Displays the query plan with full compile-time details of the SQL statement executed. Note that the TextData column does not contain the Showplan for this event.

Event.name: Showplan All For Query Compile
Event.description: Occurs when an SQL statement compiles. Displays complete, compile-time data. Use to identify Showplan operators.

Event.name: Showplan Statistics Profile
Event.description: Displays the query plan with full run-time details of the SQL statement executed. Note that the TextData column does not contain the Showplan for this event.

Event.name: Showplan Text
Event.description: Displays the query plan tree of the SQL statement from the query optimizer. Note that the TextData column does not contain the Showplan for this event.

Event.name: Showplan Text (Unencoded)
Event.description: Displays the plan tree of the Transact-SQL statement executed.

Event.name: Showplan XML
Event.description: Occurs when an SQL statement executes. Include this event to identify Showplan operators. Each event is stored in a well-formed XML document. Note that the Binary column for this event contains the encoded Showplan. Use SQL Server Profiler to open the trace and view the Showplan.

Event.name: Showplan XML For Query Compile
Event.description: Occurs when an SQL statement executes. Displays the complete, compile-time data. Note that the Binary column for this event contains the encoded Showplan. Use SQL Server Profiler to open the trace and view the Showplan.

Event.name: Showplan XML Statistics Profile
Event.description: Occurs when an SQL statement executes. Identifies the Showplan operators and displays complete, compile-time data. Note that the Binary column for this event contains the encoded Showplan. Use SQL Server Profiler to open the trace and view the Showplan.

Event.name: Progress Report: Online Index Operation
Event.description: Reports the progress of an online index build operation while the build process is running.

Event.name: QN: subscription
Event.description: Occurs when a query registration cannot be subscribed. The TextData column contains information about the event.

Event.name: QN: parameter table
Event.description: Information about active subscriptions is stored in internal parameter tables. This event class occurs when a parameter table is created or deleted. Typically, these tables are created or deleted when the database is restarted. The TextData column contains information about the event.

Event.name: QN: template
Event.description: A query template represents a class of subscription queries. Typically, queries in the same class are identical except for their parameter values. This event class occurs when a new subscription request falls into an already existing class of (Match), a new class (Create), or a Drop class, which indicates cleanup of templates for query classes without active subscriptions. The TextData column contains information about the event.

Event.name: QN: dynamics
Event.description: Tracks internal activities of query notifications. The TextData column contains information about the event.

Event.name: Scan:Started
Event.description: Indicates when a table or index scan has started.

Event.name: Scan:Stopped
Event.description: Indicates when a table or index scan has stopped.

Event.name: Audit Login
Event.description: Occurs when a user successfully logs in to Microsoft SQL Server.

Event.name: Audit Login Failed
Event.description: Indicates that a login attempt to SQL Server from a client failed.

Event.name: Audit Logout
Event.description: Occurs when a user logs out of SQL Server.

Event.name: Audit Server Starts and Stops
Event.description: Occurs when the SQL Server service state is modified.

Event.name: Audit Statement GDR Event
Event.description: Occurs every time a GRANT, DENY, REVOKE for a statement permission is issued by any user in SQL Server.

Event.name: Audit Object GDR Event
Event.description: Occurs every time a GRANT, DENY, REVOKE for an object permission is issued by any user in SQL Server.

Event.name: Audit AddLogin Event
Event.description: Occurs when a SQL Server login is added or removed; for sp_addlogin and sp_droplogin.

Event.name: Audit Login GDR Event
Event.description: Occurs when a Windows login right is added or removed; for sp_grantlogin, sp_revokelogin, and sp_denylogin.

Event.name: Audit Login Change Property Event
Event.description: Occurs when a property of a login, except passwords, is modified; for sp_defaultdb and sp_defaultlanguage.

Event.name: Audit Login Change Password Event
Event.description: Occurs when a SQL Server login password is changed. Passwords are not recorded.

Event.name: Audit Add Login to Server Role Event
Event.description: Occurs when a login is added or removed from a fixed server role; for sp_addsrvrolemember, and sp_dropsrvrolemember.

Event.name: Audit Add DB User Event
Event.description: Occurs when a login is added or removed as a database user (Windows or SQL Server) to a database; for sp_grantdbaccess, sp_revokedbaccess, sp_adduser, and sp_dropuser.

Event.name: Audit Add Member to DB Role Event
Event.description: Occurs when a login is added or removed as a database user (fixed or user-defined) to a database; for sp_addrolemember, sp_droprolemember, and sp_changegroup.

Event.name: Audit Add Role Event
Event.description: Occurs when a login is added or removed as a database user to a database; for sp_addrole and sp_droprole.

Event.name: Audit App Role Change Password Event
Event.description: Occurs when a password of an application role is changed.

Event.name: Audit Statement Permission Event
Event.description: Occurs when a statement permission (such as CREATE TABLE) is used.

Event.name: Audit Schema Object Access Event
Event.description: Occurs when an object permission (such as SELECT) is used, both successfully or unsuccessfully.

Event.name: Audit Backup/Restore Event
Event.description: Occurs when a BACKUP or RESTORE command is issued.

Event.name: Audit DBCC Event
Event.description: Occurs when DBCC commands are issued.

Event.name: Audit Change Audit Event
Event.description: Occurs when audit trace modifications are made.

Event.name: Audit Object Derived Permission Event
Event.description: Occurs when a CREATE, ALTER, and DROP object commands are issued.

Event.name: Audit Database Management Event
Event.description: Occurs when a database is created, altered, or dropped.

Event.name: Audit Database Object Management Event
Event.description: Occurs when a CREATE, ALTER, or DROP statement executes on database objects, such as schemas.

Event.name: Audit Database Principal Management Event
Event.description: Occurs when principals, such as users, are created, altered, or dropped from a database.

Event.name: Audit Schema Object Management Event
Event.description: Occurs when server objects are created, altered, or dropped.

Event.name: Audit Server Principal Impersonation Event
Event.description: Occurs when there is an impersonation within server scope, such as EXECUTE AS LOGIN.

Event.name: Audit Database Principal Impersonation Event
Event.description: Occurs when an impersonation occurs within the database scope, such as EXECUTE AS USER or SETUSER.

Event.name: Audit Server Object Take Ownership Event
Event.description: Occurs when the owner is changed for objects in server scope.

Event.name: Audit Database Object Take Ownership Event
Event.description: Occurs when a change of owner for objects within database scope occurs.

Event.name: Audit Change Database Owner
Event.description: Occurs when ALTER AUTHORIZATION is used to change the owner of a database and permissions are checked to do that.

Event.name: Audit Schema Object Take Ownership Event
Event.description: Occurs when ALTER AUTHORIZATION is used to assign an owner to an object and permissions are checked to do that.

Event.name: Audit Broker Conversation
Event.description: Reports audit messages related to Service Broker dialog security.

Event.name: Audit Broker Login
Event.description: Reports audit messages related to Service Broker transport security.

Event.name: Audit Server Scope GDR Event
Event.description: Indicates that a grant, deny, or revoke event for permissions in server scope occurred, such as creating a login.

Event.name: Audit Server Object GDR Event
Event.description: Indicates that a grant, deny, or revoke event for a schema object, such as a table or function, occurred.

Event.name: Audit Database Object GDR Event
Event.description: Indicates that a grant, deny, or revoke event for database objects, such as assemblies and schemas, occurred.

Event.name: Audit Server Operation Event
Event.description: Occurs when Security Audit operations such as altering settings, resources, external access, or authorization are used.

Event.name: Audit Server Alter Trace Event
Event.description: Occurs when a statement checks for the ALTER TRACE permission.

Event.name: Audit Server Object Management Event
Event.description: Occurs when server objects are created, altered, or dropped.

Event.name: Audit Server Principal Management Event
Event.description: Occurs when server principals are created, altered, or dropped.

Event.name: Audit Database Operation Event
Event.description: Occurs when database operations occur, such as checkpoint or subscribe query notification.

Event.name: Audit Database Object Access Event
Event.description: Occurs when database objects, such as schemas, are accessed.

Event.name: Mount Tape
Event.description: Occurs when a tape mount request is received.

Event.name: Server Memory Change
Event.description: SQL Server memory usage has increased or decreased by either 1 megabyte (MB) or 5 percent of the maximum server memory, whichever is greater.

Event.name: Trace File Close
Event.description: Occurs when a trace file closes during rollback.

Event.name: ExistingConnection
Event.description: Detects all activity by users connected to SQL Server before the trace started.

Event.name: RPC Output Parameter
Event.description: Produces output values of the parameters for every RPC.

Event.name: RPC:Completed
Event.description: Occurs when a remote procedure call (RPC) has completed.

Event.name: RPC:Starting
Event.description: Occurs when an RPC has started.

Event.name: SP:CacheHit
Event.description: Indicates when a stored procedure is found in the procedure cache.

Event.name: SP:CacheInsert
Event.description: Indicates when an item is inserted into the procedure cache.

Event.name: SP:CacheMiss
Event.description: Indicates when a stored procedure is not found in the procedure cache.

Event.name: SP:CacheRemove
Event.description: Indicates when an item is removed from the procedure cache.

Event.name: SP:Recompile
Event.description: Indicates that a stored procedure was recompiled.

Event.name: SP:Completed
Event.description: Indicates when the stored procedure has completed.

Event.name: SP:Starting
Event.description: Indicates when the stored procedure has started.

Event.name: SP:StmtCompleted
Event.description: Indicates that a Transact-SQL statement within a stored procedure has finished executing.

Event.name: SP:StmtStarting
Event.description: Indicates that a Transact-SQL statement within a stored procedure has started executing.

Event.name: SQL:BatchCompleted
Event.description: Occurs when a Transact-SQL batch has completed.

Event.name: SQL:BatchStarting
Event.description: Occurs when a Transact-SQL batch has started.

Event.name: SQL:StmtStarting
Event.description: Occurs when the Transact-SQL statement has started.

Event.name: SQL:StmtCompleted
Event.description: Occurs when the Transact-SQL statement has completed.

Event.name: Prepare SQL
Event.description: ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library has prepared a Transact-SQL statement or statements for use.

Event.name: Exec Prepared SQL
Event.description: ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library has executed a prepared Transact-SQL statement or statements.

Event.name: Unprepare SQL
Event.description: ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library has unprepared (deleted) a prepared Transact-SQL statement or statements.

Event.name: SQL:StmtRecompile
Event.description: Occurs when a statement-level recompilation occurs.

Event.name: XQuery Static Type
Event.description: Occurs when an XQuery expression is executed. This event class provides the static type of the XQuery expression.

Event.name: DTCTransaction
Event.description: Tracks Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator (MS DTC) coordinated transactions between two or more databases.

Event.name: SQL Transaction
Event.description: Tracks Transact-SQL BEGIN, COMMIT, SAVE, and ROLLBACK TRANSACTION statements.

Event.name: TM: Begin Tran starting
Event.description: Occurs when a BEGIN TRANSACTION request starts.

Event.name: TM: Begin Tran completed
Event.description: Occurs when a BEGIN TRANSACTION request completes.

Event.name: TM: Promote Tran starting
Event.description: Occurs when a PROMOTE TRANSACTION request starts.

Event.name: TM: Promote Tran completed
Event.description: Occurs when a PROMOTE TRANSACTION request completes.

Event.name: TM: Commit Tran starting
Event.description: Occurs when a COMMIT TRANSACTION request starts.

Event.name: TM: Commit Tran completed
Event.description: Occurs when a COMMIT TRANSACTION request completes.

Event.name: TM: Rollback Tran starting
Event.description: Occurs when a ROLLBACK TRANSACTION request starts.

Event.name: TM: Rollback Tran completed
Event.description: Occurs when a ROLLBACK TRANSACTION request completes.

Event.name: TM: Save Tran starting
Event.description: Occurs when a SAVE TRANSACTION request starts.

Event.name: TM: Save Tran completed
Event.description: Occurs when a SAVE TRANSACTION request completes.

Event.name: TransactionLog
Event.description: Tracks when transactions are written to the transaction log.

Event.name: User Configurable 0
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 1
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 2
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 3
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 4
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 5
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 6
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 7
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 8
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 9
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.
